tweets.text:
There are #FloodWarnings in place as #StormChristoph brings heavy rain across England.  

Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7Fwblnq  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MaE7ptFod2
Our flood forecast shows the areas at risk of flooding over the next three days: https://t.co/CGrMNcJc4n #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/INNNWi5CsF

Looking forward to speaking at tomorrow's Coastal Futures Ocean Recovery Conference alongside @FinlayPringle & @eimear_stephens! üì£

We're bringing young people's voices to the fore as part of the "Youth Voices For The Ocean" session üåä

#CoastalFutures21 #OceanRecovery @wwf_uk https://t.co/bO7RQsaChO

#DoYouKnow what to do in flood? 

#StormChristoph will bring widespread flood alerts and warnings across the North West over the next few days. 

Check your flood risk here ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/ZAITy41Ta6 https://t.co/GMyAQDBuRU

There are a number of flood warnings in place across England, with heavy rainfall expected in the next few days.

By knowing what to do in a #flood, you can reduce the impacts to your home, family and possessions.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#StormCristoph https://t.co/FMPUiziILV

tweets.text:
We‚Äôve been out this morning clearing debris to allow the water to run through and avoid blockages that could lead to flooding

A lot of heavy rain on the way so stay #FloodAware

Find the latest flood information and sign up to receive flood warnings here: https://t.co/BJMOHy1L66 https://t.co/wHEohCZiD9

We are expecting heavy rainfall across #Yorkshire this week. 
Get the latest flood info & sign up to receive flood warnings here: 
https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb
#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/WMqZBhzoxy

tweets.text: .@EnvAgencySE .@KentHighways not sure who is responsible for this brickwork, by the Black Robin, Valley Road, Kingston CT4. It‚Äôs the edge of the culvert for the river to go under the road and the river is only a day or so away. https://t.co/1F10nksDCY

Our teams are out & about the #Midlands clearing blockages like here at Thorpe Astley #Leicestershire in advance of forecasted heavy rain. Please keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/v2EnVHrvng
Supporting the deployment of #Severn side North at #Bewdley today working with the #Worcestershire field team @EnvAgencyMids #CovidSafe https://t.co/mWQk1zst1h

Flood sirens going off in #Sileby #Leicestershire as water levels rise on the Sileby Brook which runs through the village. Currently two flood warnings in place in the East Midlands as #StormChristoph approaches @EnvAgency @ITVCentral #flooding https://t.co/c9sMBmHjB2

We‚Äôre expecting widespread heavy rain across North East & Yorks this week which could lead to some flooding. As a precaution residents and businesses should be aware we‚Äôre closing the gates at Yarm at noon today. Check the latest here:  
https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/VxDwtEenPc

We‚Äôre making sure rivers and streams aren‚Äôt blocked by debris‚Ä¶

Like here at Hamstreet, near #Ashford, in #Kent

Rubbish and branches ‚Äì and the occasional tree ‚Äì increase flood-risk‚Ä¶ 

Check and register for flood alerts: https://t.co/6wEuixUq8S
#StormChristoph #floodaware https://t.co/926np7FLp0

Being prepared and knowing what to do in a #flood can reduce damage to your home and possessions by around 40%.

Find out what to do when you receive a flood warning and download our simple flood plan - https://t.co/vkHcHO9ADQ https://t.co/B44JQTpjSD

So step away from the tin and leave those sharks alone! #Oceanhero @JNCC_UK @WWF @EnvAgency https://t.co/Mjwaedtv4C

tweets.text: With Storm Christoph likely to cause heavy rainfall early tomorrow, we may see some flood alerts in place across Leeds. Here‚Äôs a useful guide from @EnvAgencyYNE showing what each flood alert means. More info at https://t.co/qxopW25Dr5 #PrepareActSurvive #Leeds https://t.co/6bd9UoAGXC

#StormChristoph has now reached the North West with heavy rain falling across the whole region. 

Sign up now for free flood warnings ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

#beprepared #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/gwYxiCjrYe

@HasisD @0xley @floodforesight @metoffice @EnvAgency Thanks for your feedback and we are glad the map is of interest. We appreciate that a forecast is never going to be a crystal ball but hope these footprints provide an indication of areas that might be affected. 1/2

Very heavy rain is expected over the next 24 hours so please make sure you are prepared by following the latest updates from @EnvAgencyNW and @metoffice. Information and advice is also available on our website - https://t.co/CIwQ4NipwB #StormChristoph https://t.co/nPBPXSAyMr

‚ö†Ô∏èFlood Alert ‚ö†Ô∏è | Flood alerts are being issued today Tues, 19 Jan in Herefordshire, with river levels expected to remain high until Fri, 22 Jan as #StormChristoph continues. Take care on the roads, avoid flood water & follow the latest flood warnings: https://t.co/NWbmOy14gF https://t.co/fTCoqUyWZ9
@0xley @JBARisk @floodforesight @metoffice @EnvAgency Yeah, have to admit it does express a degree of geographic precision that I‚Äôm not overly comfortable with either.

urls.title: Sussex Flow Initiative recognised for ''integral role'' in reducing flood risk - Lewes and Eastbourne Councils
urls.description: The Chair of Lewes District Council has spoken about the "integral role" the Sussex Flow Initiative is playing in tackling flood risk in the Ouse catchment across the Lewes district.

tweets.text:
Thanks to @LewesDC for supporting the nature based solutions of @SussexFlow to reduce #FloodRisk #NFM

A partnership between @SussexWildlife @WoodlandTrust & @EnvAgencySE

https://t.co/7NFy8MshLf https://t.co/vnnITujX7J
Yellow warning of rain affecting North West England https://t.co/96eZvOz1V1 https://t.co/GfzBKbIAF5

There is also a Met Office Yellow Warning for further heavy rain on Wednesday and Thursday as Storm Christoph hits the UK.
Householders should sign up to the Environment Agency's flood warning service  - https://t.co/t5DcZ5CMZq Thank you to @kenthighways and @envagencyse 4/4 https://t.co/lGguhuvPIp

Prepare now for #StormChristoph and sign up for flood warnings in your area here https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/4dola2dANt

Interesting - I raised this with @EnvAgency as a significant risk due to local topography and building shape for the #Rivenhall waste incinerator. They ignored that and all other objections and gave a permit for a 600ktpa incinerator with a stack just 35m above local ground level https://t.co/2TB2Ow3RmA

urls.title: Heavy rain increases flood risk across Melton Borough
urls.description: Heavy rain overnight is adding to already high river levels following recent heavy rainfall in recent days. Roads including Saxby Road, Melton and Leicester Road, Kirby Bellars are flooded along with Lag Lane (Thorpe Road to Saxby Road). The Drift in Wymondham is also flooded after the River Witham burst its banks on T

tweets.text: Frisby residents urged to take action and  move possessions and valuables off the ground or to safety and turn off gas, electricity and water. https://t.co/FmD3zEk1vG @EnvAgencyMids @LeicsCountyHall

Don't drive through #Flood water. 

#StormChristoph will cause large puddles on the roads and the risk of flooding

Don't get trapped in your car. Only an egg cup full of water in the engine can stop it working.

Turn around, don't drown!
@EnvAgency https://t.co/wm7ITgct6M
